{"step_by_step_thinking": "The role of a barrier membrane in guided tissue regeneration (GTR) is to prevent epithelial migration into the area where regeneration of other tissues, such as bone, is desired. This is important because the barrier membrane creates a space for the infiltration of slow-growing bone cells into the defect site. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Prevention of epithelial migration.", "answer_choice": "B"}
